subject: Medicine
title: The Lymphatic Highway
description: Learn The Lymphatic Highway in one minute.

hook.text: Swollen glands during a cold aren't damage. They're command centers ramping up for battle.

buildup.text: The lymphatic system is a network of vessels and nodes that transport immune cells throughout the body.

discovery.text: Lymph nodes filter fluid and concentrate immune cellsâ€”creating meeting points where threats are identified.

twist.text: Cancer often spreads through lymph nodes. Surgeons check them first to see if cancer has traveled.

climax.text: The lymphatic system is the immune system's highwayâ€”moving soldiers, intelligence, and supplies.

punchline.text: Swollen nodes mean your defenses are mobilizing.

quiz.question: Why do lymph nodes swell during an infection?
options: Immune cells multiply there to fight the detected threat
Bacteria accumulate and clog the nodes
The body stores excess fluid during illness
